poem:
**A Dubious Meeting in Gold**

In a room of gold and false decree,  
two men, crowned in their own conceit,  
basked in audacious impunity—  
while outside, absent,  
fates were sealed,  
a father's voice, a story untold,  
lost amid the gilded farce.  
Silent are truths in hidden folds.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump’s gilded Oval Office was the perfect setting for his and Bukele’s grotesque spectacle | Julia Carrie Wong The Oval Office meeting of Donald Trump and Nayib Bukele on Monday was a grotesque spectacle. Both men, elected to lead nominally democratic countries, have described themselves as dictators, and they exuded that sense of smug impunity. While reporters sought answers on the fate of Kilmar Ábrego García, a 29-year-old father of three who was wrongly deported". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
